intro: Zygostates rotundiglossa, commonly known as the round-tongue lily, is a herbaceous plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale pink. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in cool, humid environments. Its leaves are broad and lance-shaped, often forming a basal rosette, while its flowering stems rise above the foliage. Zygostates rotundiglossa is prized for its ornamental value and is often cultivated in botanical gardens and specialized collections.
